docs.lead_paragraph: A University of Montana student who disappeared over the weekend during a fishing trip was found alive on Tuesday near the state's border with Idaho where his sport utility vehicle had broken down, authorities said.

headline.main: Montana College Student Missing After Fishing Trip Found Alive
headline.print_headline: Montana College Student Missing After Fishing Trip Found Alive

docs.lead_paragraph: The wife of a prominent Chinese dissident appealed to U.S. President Barack Obama on Tuesday to make a public call for her husband to be allowed to travel to the United States, saying he was in "alarmingly poor health" and needed medical treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jimmie Johnson said the cooling system for his helmet was blowing warm air and that likely caused his dehydration following last week's race at Richmond.

headline.main: An American Yazidi Trying to Save Iraqi Yazidis

docs.abstract: Sharifa Khalil was just days old when her family crawled under a fence at the Iraq-Syria border in 1988 to escape Saddam Hussein’s rule. Now a resident of Lincoln, Nebraska, Sharifa is working with other members of the persecuted Yazidi minority to try to avert a genocide of the Yazidis back in Iraq.

docs.lead_paragraph: A win in the season-opening Daytona 500 guaranteed Dale Earnhardt Jr. a spot in NASCAR's title race. It also allowed his Hendrick Motorsports team to live in the moment on the race track and not get hung up on results.

headline.main: Hendrick, Penske and Harvick Gearing Up for Chase
headline.print_headline: Hendrick, Penske and Harvick Gearing Up for Chase

docs.lead_paragraph: A fourth American who contracted Ebola in West Africa was expected to arrive in the U.S. for care Tuesday and will be treated at an Atlanta hospital where two other aid workers successfully recovered from the disease, the hospital said Monday.

headline.main: 4th American With Ebola to Be Flown to US for Care
headline.print_headline: 4th American With Ebola to Be Flown to US for Care

docs.snippet: A fourth American who contracted Ebola in West Africa was expected to arrive in the U.S. for care Tuesday and will be treated at an Atlanta hospital where two other aid workers successfully recovered from the disease, the hospital said Monday.

headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Mixed News on Obesity Rates

docs.abstract: In 2013, adult obesity rates rose in six states – Alaska, Delaware, Idaho, New Jersey, Tennessee and Wyoming – which was a drastic shift from 2005, when the rate increased in every state.
docs.snippet: In 2013, adult obesity rates rose in six states – Alaska, Delaware, Idaho, New Jersey, Tennessee and Wyoming – which was a drastic shift from 2005, when the rate increased in every state.

docs.lead_paragraph: The senior housing industry is preparing to serve a wave of residents who expect more than mush on their plates.

headline.main: Grandma’s Meat Loaf? Hardly. Her Retirement Home Now Has a 3-Star Chef.
headline.print_headline: Grandma’s Meat Loaf? Hardly. Her Home Now Has a 3-Star Chef.

docs.abstract: Nursing homes and senior living communities nationwide are hiring professional chefs and adopting gourmet techniques as they prepare to cater to aging baby boomers and their more demanding palettes; shift reflects importance of food as a cultural currency among an aging population.
docs.snippet: The senior housing industry is preparing to serve a wave of residents who expect more than mush on their plates.
